Description: Rectangular white stuccoed and painted wooden writing-board with a hole pierced in one side; inscribed with the Sayings of Khakheperraseneb.
Curator's comments: Parkinson R B, 1996, 'Khakheperreseneb and traditional belles lettres' in Studies in honor of William Kelly Simpson 2, 647-654 Lichtheim: Ancient Egyptian Literature: Volume I (1973), p.145-149. Translation: R. Parkinson, The Tale of Sinuhe and Other ancient Egyptian Poems 1940-1649 BC (Oxford World's Classics 1999), 144-50. I. Regulski (ed.), Hieroglyphs: unlocking ancient Egypt (2022), pp. 140-1
Bibliographic references: Shaw & Nicholson 1995 / British Museum Dictionary of Ancient Egypt (p164)
Parkinson 1997 / The Text of "Khakheperreseneb": New Readings of EA 5645, and an Unpublished Ostracon
Exhibition history: 2022-2023 13 Oct-19 Feb, London, BM, Hieroglyphs: unlocking ancient Egypt
